intro: Dendrobium parvulum subsp. huliorum, commonly known as the Hulio Orchid, is a compact epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It features short, upright pseudobulbs that support its evergreen leaves, which are narrow and革质 (leathery). The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow, typically during the summer months. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining potting media. Due to its compact size and ornamental value, it is a popular choice for both indoor cultivation and terrariums.
